timeline.message:
Reorganize optimization strategies

Signed-off-by: Florian Grieskamp <florian.grieskamp@gdata.de>

Reorganize optimization strategies

Signed-off-by: Florian Grieskamp <florian.grieskamp@gdata.de>

timeline.bodyText: Is there any way to compare steps other than toString()?
timeline.author: li-boxuan

replies.bodyText: I didn't find one. If you (or anyone) knows how to do it better, please let me know :)
replies.author: rngcntr

replies.bodyText: IIRC there was a problem that equality on steps does not work as expected because of some == / equals discrepancies. I can look at that again and then reply back
replies.author: rngcntr

timeline.author: li-boxuan

timeline.bodyText: nitpick: Can you add Javadoc for this method? The method name itself is not clear enough to understand its usage.
timeline.author: li-boxuan

timeline.bodyText: This test involves composite indexes, which is worth testing against different backends IMO.
timeline.author: li-boxuan

replies.bodyText: I never thought of it that way. My idea of it is more like: If the backends are well tested, their functioning can be assumed equivalent. Therefore it's the scope of the index tests to ensure that the backend fulfills the specification. Based on that the optimization tests can then assume a functionally correct index.
replies.author: rngcntr

replies.bodyText: Are you ok with keeping this as it is? And if so, would you please review the PR again? Thanks!
replies.author: rngcntr

replies.bodyText: That's a fair assumption. I am okay with it but I'd like to leave this conversation open in case anyone has any other opinion.
replies.author: li-boxuan
